title: How would the girl's name 'Pyrrha Nikos' look handwritten in cursive Greek lettering, conforming to the spelling rules and diacritical markings used in ancient Greek? - Quora

response.answer_text: Νonononono. Pyrrha Nikos means nothing. Actually Nikos is the male name for Nick (Nicholas). Pyrrhios Nike is the female form but it is still NOT something you want to name a child. You see, it comes from Pyrrhic victory - Wikipedia : a victory that inflicts such a devastating toll on the victor that it is tantamount to defeat So you wouldn’t want it written… anywhere especially with regards to a little child! If you’re still interested in how it would look copy and paste: Πύρρειος Νίκη into a word document and select a cursive font, e.g. Monotype Corsiva or Mistral  You should also note that these are Old Greek, not Ancient Greek. In ancient times it would be displayed as ΠΥΡΡΕΙΟΣΝΙΚΗ If you meant something else, please elaborate.
not sure about ancient greek markings. Also it depends if the “h” is silent or not. If it is then it would be spelled “πυρρα νικος”, or “πυρρχα νικος” if it isn’t
